intro: Peucedanum terebinthaceum var. hakuunense, commonly known as the Japanese cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
